content:
• Thursday, December 27, 2012
  • MEG

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: MEG +14%. DIOD +4%. AKS +2%. AVEO +2%. VIXM +2%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: MEG +14%. DIOD +4%. AKS +2%. AVEO +2%. VIXM +2%.
    After-hours top losers: NGL -4%. MHO -3%. KRO -3%. ERII -2%. TVIX -2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:46 PM
  • OMER

    Omeros (NASDAQ:OMER) trades lower in the post-session after reporting that results from its...

    Omeros (NASDAQ:OMER) trades lower in the post-session after reporting that results from its first Phase 3 clinical trial evaluating OMS103HP in patients undergoing arthroscopic knee surgery did not meet endpoints. However, the drug developer said its plans for another study remain on track for the first half of next year. Shares -6.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:29 PM
  • GEOS

    Geospace Technologies (NASDAQ:GEOS) announces receipt of an order from Dawson Geophysical...

    Geospace Technologies (NASDAQ:GEOS) announces receipt of an order from Dawson Geophysical (NASDAQ:DWSN) for 12K stations of its single-channel GSX wireless recording system valued at $13.2M. Upon delivery, DWSN says it will own at least 73K channels of GSR and GSX equipment and 179K total channels. GEOS -1.9%, DWSN +0.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:28 PM
  • PFE

    Cryoport (CYRX.OB +36%) ramps higher today after disclosing that it was engaged by Pfizer...

    Cryoport (CYRX.OB +36%) ramps higher today after disclosing that it was engaged by Pfizer (NYSE:PFE) to manage all domestic and international frozen shipments of their primary animal vaccines. CYRX will use its Cryoportal system to manage shipments from PFE's manufacturing site in the U.S. to its domestic customers as well as its international distribution centers.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:01 PM
  • FXEN

    FX Energy (FXEN +1.7%) says it has spudded a new well on a 100%-owned concession in Poland, with...

    FX Energy (FXEN +1.7%) says it has spudded a new well on a 100%-owned concession in Poland, with its Tuchola-3K well targeting a reservoir in the main dolomite section at a projected depth of 2,550 meters. FXEN also plans to begin drilling a second well there within the next several weeks.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM | 1 Comment

  • Renewable Energy Group (REGI -2.6% ) says it's paid off the long-term debt of its operating...

    Renewable Energy Group (REGI -2.6% ) says it's paid off the long-term debt of its operating biorefinery subsidiary in Seneca, Illinois, by retiring its $34.5M outstanding long-term debt obligation on December 21 with cash generated from operations since April 2010.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM
  • CPRI

    After selling off yesterday along with other retail names, Michael Kors (KORS -3.3%) is lower...

    After selling off yesterday along with other retail names, Michael Kors (KORS -3.3%) is lower today thanks to a critical note from Citi. Analyst Oliver Chen says checks indicate discounts for Kors handbags are greater than those seen on Black Friday, and in some cases amount to 30%-50% below their retail price. He's lowering his estimates and slashing his PT to $60 from $68, albeit while maintaining a Buy.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM | 1 Comment
  • AMRS

    Renewable chemicals and fuels company Amyris (AMRS -6.3%) sinks after saying it's sold around...

    Renewable chemicals and fuels company Amyris (AMRS -6.3%) sinks after saying it's sold around 14M shares, totaling about $42.25M in a private placement. The transaction included $37.25M in cash and the conversion by Total Gas & Power USA, SAS of $5M from an outstanding senior unsecured convertible promissory note. Separately, it adds that its industrial fermentation facility in Brazil has successfully begun producing Biofene, the company's brand of renewable farnesene.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM
  • HQCL

    Hanwha SolarOne (HSOL +6%) trades up after saying it's reached an agreement with the Bank of...

    Hanwha SolarOne (HSOL +6%) trades up after saying it's reached an agreement with the Bank of Beijing for access to up to approximately $475M worth of credit over the next 12-months. Drawdown of specific amount is subject to approval procedures of the Bank of Beijing, including review of specific project information, as applicable.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM
  • SGYP

    Synergy Pharmaceuticals (SGYP +5.3%) moves up after saying its commenced Phase IIb clinical...

    Synergy Pharmaceuticals (SGYP +5.3%) moves up after saying its commenced Phase IIb clinical trials of plecanatide, a treatment for patients with constipation-predominant irritable bowel syndrome. The trial is being conducted at 70 sites in the U.S. and includes 350 patients. Parexel International (PRXL -2%) is the contract research organization for the trial.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM
  • BAS

    Estimates for Basic Energy Services' (BAS -5.7%) Q4, 2013 and 2014 are lowered at Jefferies to...

    Estimates for Basic Energy Services' (BAS -5.7%) Q4, 2013 and 2014 are lowered at Jefferies to reflect operating weakness, including modestly more day rate pressure and concerns about at least H1 2013 activity in Permian and Mid-Con regions. The firm says it prefers peers with stronger free cash flow profiles.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM
  • CHMT

    Specialized chemical maker Chemtura (CHMT +2.9%) trades up on an otherwise down day, after...

    Specialized chemical maker Chemtura (CHMT +2.9%) trades up on an otherwise down day, after Longbow Research upgraded the shares to a Buy with a $26 price target. The firm cites a number of catalysts, including the company's acquisition of Solaris' bromine assets, a reinvigorated AgroSolutions pipeline, and an eventual divestiture of it's consumer products. The stock has been a solid performer this year, up over 86% YTD.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:54 PM
  • BCDS

    Midday top 10 gainers: BCDS +92%. FSGI +19%. ENPH +15%. RGLS +11%. MNGA +10%. CLNT +9%. OSBC...

    Midday top 10 gainers: BCDS +92%. FSGI +19%. ENPH +15%. RGLS +11%. MNGA +10%. CLNT +9%. OSBC +9%. DECK +8%. BLIN +8%. PZE +7%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: SSE-OLD -16%. SPMD -14%. GNI -12%. CIG -12%. CHC -14%. SARA -9%. TOWR -9%. OTCQB:TELK -9%. DQ -8%. AMRS -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • BASI

    Bioanalytical Systems (BASI -6%) slides after reporting a big miss on it Q4 earnings earlier...

    Bioanalytical Systems (BASI -6%) slides after reporting a big miss on it Q4 earnings earlier today. Quarterly revenue slid 19.7% Y/Y to $6.54 million, well under the $7.07 million the Street was expecting. The company blames the miss on about about $2.51M in restructuring charges, primarily consisting of U.K. exit costs, during the quarter. It notes however, that this is expected to be the final charge associated with the company's restructuring.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM
  • ES-OLD

    EnergySolutions (ES-OLD +1.6%) enjoys positive comments and a new $4 target price (from $3) at...

    EnergySolutions (ES-OLD +1.6%) enjoys positive comments and a new $4 target price (from $3) at Wedbush, which expects corporate actions including restructuring and cost reductions, completion of asset sales in early 2013 and debt repayment in Q1 to provide catalysts for the share price over the next 60-90 days.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM
  • MNK

    Questcor (QCOR -6%) gets hit today after Blue Cross/Blue Shield of Michigan denies coverage of...

    Questcor (QCOR -6%) gets hit today after Blue Cross/Blue Shield of Michigan denies coverage of it's Acthar Gel for steroid-responsive conditions, saying the clinical need has not been demonstrated. Coverage will continue to be provided however, for treatment of infantile spasms, which is one of its FDA approved indications.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM | 17 Comments
  • BPZ

    BPZ Resources (BPZ +4.7%) says it closed its contractual arrangements for the sale of a 49%...

    BPZ Resources (BPZ +4.7%) says it closed its contractual arrangements for the sale of a 49% participating interest in Block Z-1 offshore Peru to Pacific Rubiales Energy (PEGFF.PK). The two companies waived and modified certain contract conditions in order to effect an accelerated closing of the transaction.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • POOSF

    Poseidon Concepts (OTC:POOSF -54.9%) sets up a special board committee to review its business...

    Poseidon Concepts (OTC:POOSF -54.9%) sets up a special board committee to review its business controls and suspends dividend payments, names chairman Scott Dawson as interim president and CEO, and says the special committee will look at further managerial changes. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM
  • KAR

    KAR Auction Services (KAR +4%) gains on an upgrade to Overweight by analysts at Stephens. The...

    KAR Auction Services (KAR +4%) gains on an upgrade to Overweight by analysts at Stephens. The firm cites better industry fundamentals and expectations for vehicle volume to accelerate during the second half of next year. The price target has also been raised to $23 from $19.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM
  • BCDS

    Though it's paying a giant premium to acquire BCD Semiconductor (BCDS +94%), Diodes (DIOD +2.9%)...

    Though it's paying a giant premium to acquire BCD Semiconductor (BCDS +94%), Diodes (DIOD +2.9%) is trading higher after announcing the deal, as the Street applauds BCD's potential to expand Diodes' product line and Chinese customer base. BCD is currently trading at $7.72, 3.5% below Diodes' $8/share buyout price.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • SNOA

    Oculus Innovative Sciences (OCLS +5.3%) says it's been issued a new patent for the use of...

    Oculus Innovative Sciences (OCLS +5.3%) says it's been issued a new patent for the use of Microcyn Technology in the treatment of skin ulcers. Microcyn Technology can be delivered to skin ulcers via washing, irrigation and soaking or through application of a wound dressing saturated in the treatment.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • DXTR

    Cardica (CRDC +7.8%) says it's shipped its first batch of commercial MicroCutter...

    Cardica (CRDC +7.8%) says it's shipped its first batch of commercial MicroCutter cutting/stapling devices and cartridges to Dach Medical Group, its distributor for Germany, Austria and Switzerland. CRDC says the ramp up in European commercial sales is part of a focused effort to prepare for a planned U.S. regulatory submission.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM
  • BBY

    Best Buy (BBY -1.7%), RadioShack (RSH -4.4%), and J.C. Penney (JCP -3.8%) slump after being...

    Best Buy (BBY -1.7%), RadioShack (RSH -4.4%), and J.C. Penney (JCP -3.8%) slump after being named by the WSJ, along with Sears (SHLD -0.1%), as retailers facing a "do or die" 2013. The paper notes a recent Harris poll indicated 1 in 4 shoppers who had "showroomed" had done so at Best Buy, and that RadioShack's decision to focus on phone/tablet sales has crushed its margins. Many retailers sold off yesterday on negative sales data, though J.C. Penney didn't.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM | 1 Comment
  • SOQ

    Sonde Resources (SOQ +13.3%) announces approval of an extension of its exploratory obligations...

    Sonde Resources (SOQ +13.3%) announces approval of an extension of its exploratory obligations in Libya; the second-phase work program will include one new exploratory well to be drilled each year through 2015, and acquisition of a 200 sq. km. offshore 3D seismic.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM
  • NE

    Noble Corp. (NE -1.7%) says it is working to fix maintenance issues the U.S. Coast Guard found...

    Noble Corp. (NE -1.7%) says it is working to fix maintenance issues the U.S. Coast Guard found with its Noble Discoverer drillship, located offshore Alaska. NE also says its internal review reported other potential noncompliance issues relating to its operations, including possible unauthorized collected water discharges outside the allowed period of Alaska drilling operations.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • SEII

    Cleantech Solutions (CLNT +8%) says it's been given a new, 10-year patent certificate from...

    Cleantech Solutions (CLNT +8%) says it's been given a new, 10-year patent certificate from China's State Intellectual Property Office for a production technique enabling more-effective cloth washing in dyeing machines under high temperature and pressure. The technique sheds debris and cotton husks on the surface of fabric, which allows the cloth to be washed much more cleanly and within the cooling vats, thereby reducing the time required for dyeing.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM
  • DECK

    Deckers (DECK +7.1%) has shot higher in early trading, apparently on evidence Ugg boot demand...

    Deckers (DECK +7.1%) has shot higher in early trading, apparently on evidence Ugg boot demand remains healthy. 44.9% of the float was shorted as of Nov. 30, and with shares down over 50% on the year, some of those shorts are probably looking to book some year-end profits.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM
  • MRVL

    Marvell (MRVL -3.5%) is adding to the 11% decline it saw yesterday after Pittsburgh jury awarded...

    Marvell (MRVL -3.5%) is adding to the 11% decline it saw yesterday after Pittsburgh jury awarded Carnegie Mellon $1.17B in damages in a patent infringement suit against the chipmaker. Likely playing a role is a downgrade to Market Perform from JMP: the firm is worried about the impact of the verdict on Marvell's balance sheet, notes other lawsuits also exist, and (unsurprisingly) says checks indicate PC demand is soft.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM
  • AOBC

    Smith & Wesson (SWHC) authorizes another $15M of purchases after announcing a $20M stock...

    Smith & Wesson (SWHC) authorizes another $15M of purchases after announcing a $20M stock buyback effort to run through June 30 as part of its FQ2 report three weeks ago. The gun maker says it spent that $20M, and the additional $15M in purchases will have the same June 30 deadline. SWHC +2.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM | 1 Comment
  • PRXL

    Parexel (PRXL +2.1%) acquires Liquent for $72M. The shares rose after the firm raised 2Q13...

    Parexel (PRXL +2.1%) acquires Liquent for $72M. The shares rose after the firm raised 2Q13 revenue guidance to $415M-$420M, GAAP EPS to be in range of $0.31-$0.34 and FY13 revenue of $1.67B-$1.69B and adj. EPS to be in range of $1.36-$1.43. The acquisition is expected to have dilutive impact of $0.02-$0.04 for FY13. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:17 AM
  • BCDS

    Premarket gainers: BCDS +95%. SGOC +15%. Losers: CIG -11%.

    Premarket gainers: BCDS +95%. SGOC +15%.
    Losers: CIG -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • VALE

    Vale (NYSE:VALE) says it may sell its stake in Brazilian logistics firm Log-In Logistica...

    Vale (NYSE:VALE) says it may sell its stake in Brazilian logistics firm Log-In Logistica Intermodal, as it continues to sell off assets it doesn't consider part of its core iron ore business. Vale's 31% stake in the company could be worth as much as 217M reais ($106M). Vale also says it sold its 25% stake in a Brazilian oil and gas exploration partnership to Statoil (STO). VALE +1.6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:07 AM
